page.title: 05FORDAM FETE PREPARATIONS
page.content: For each of the past twenty years Fordham has had a village fete. The money that is raised is divided equally between the{church}and the {village}hall.The preparations for the fete begin the previous October. Anyone who is willing and interested may join the committee. The first thing to be decided is the date of the fete. When the date has been settled decisions are taken as to the stalls. Then the main attractions are discussed and this year crane rides and an army display team were chosen. Raffle prizes have to be bought or donated and the main prize chosen. This year it was binoculars. In the preceding months extra ideas are discussed and added to the programme. The stalls are erected on the morning of the fete.This years fete raised {eight hundred pounds.
